summary: This is a letter from the Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York to Mark Epstein, informing him of the death of his brother, Jeffrey Epstein, on August 10, 2019, at New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital. The letter expresses condolences and notes that the cause of death is not yet known, and that Jeffrey Epstein's personal effects and funds will be forwarded to Mark.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the letter, identified as having passed away on August 10, 2019, while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: The recipient of the condolence letter from the Warden, regarding the death of his brother Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Warden MCC New York
persons.role: Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center
persons.context: The author of the letter, expressing official condolences and informing Mark Epstein of his brother's death and the handling of his effects.

connections.description: Mark Epstein is identified as the brother of Jeffrey Epstein in the condolence letter.
The Warden was responsible for Jeffrey Epstein while he was an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Edward Epstein was pronounced deceased at New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York 10007
New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital, New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died on August 10, 2019, while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
He was pronounced deceased at New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital.
At the time of the letter, there were no preliminary reports identifying the exact cause of death.
The letter was sent to Mark Epstein, Jeffrey Epstein's brother, to inform him of the death and the handling of personal effects and funds.
The document is an official condolence letter from the prison warden, dated the same day as Jeffrey Epstein's death.
